sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: With Ukraine expecting 140 Leopard tanks from allies, F-16s are next on its wish list in talks with President Biden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Thousands of protesters take to the streets of France amid a second wave of demonstrations against the government's pension reform plans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Tens of thousands of health and social care workers march through Brussels demanding better pay and conditions across the sector.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The European Automotive Industry urges Brussels to help stimulate the green transition or risk a loss of its global competitive edge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Busy times at Poland's Leopard Tank Training Centre. Its main pupils are currently from the Ukrainian army. Ukraine expects to receive between 120 and 140 main battle tanks in the first wave of deliveries from its Western allies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But Ukraine is also asking for F-16 multi-role fighters to curb Russia's air force in its skies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Allies are hesitating over the request, but some less than others.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Meeting in Riga, the foreign ministers of the Baltic republics and Poland supported the Ukrainian request.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As Estonia's foreign minister put it, they need fighters, missiles and tanks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We have to act. President Biden was being a little more circumspect.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Have you spoken to Zelensky recently and what are you going to tell him about his further request?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So far, London and Washington have refused to deliver F-16s to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So far, London and Washington have refused to deliver F-16s to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Moscow continues to claim breakthroughs on the front.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It claims to have destroyed French and American weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: At the same time, Moscow has released images of a military train equipped with what it calls the latest technology and designed for technical reconnaissance, demining and repair of the railway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The number of people who've been killed in a suicide bombing in Pakistan has risen to at least 80. Most of the victims were police officers who were praying in a mosque in Peshawar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Pakistan's Prime Minister Shabazz Sharif has visited the wounded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Some were suffering from burns, others had broken bones from being hit by falling rubble.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The mosque is in one of the most heavily controlled areas of the city, which includes police headquarters and intelligence and counter-terrorism bureaus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Pakistani Taliban has denied involvement after an initial claim by one of its commanders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Cities across France have been brought to a near standstill in the latest nationwide protest over pension reforms planned by President Macron's administration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Thousands took to the streets in multiple rallies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The government wants to raise the retirement age from 62 to 64.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Unions and leftist parties are firmly resisting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's a kind of citizens' uprising of the people who are protesting against the fact that the government wants to take away from them this very simple thing, the right to lead a human existence and therefore to stop working after a certain age because of the body, the mind and the nerves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Everything is worn out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Commuters faced a difficult start to the day with transport reduced to a minimum service.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Polls show that people are opposed to the reforms and the strike has widespread public support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I can't take part in the demonstration but I'm with them totally for all the issues, for women.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I've heard that it's not equal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I think we're being asked to make an effort and so on. But is the government making an effort? Are they doing the same thing? I don't think so. I don't think so at all.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Those who will be impacted most by the changes, young people, also join the strikes in some places.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Unions claim the action has spread to more sectors than ever before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They promise to continue the protests in the weeks ahead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But the government insists it will offer only minor amendments and that the new retirement age is not up for negotiation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As many as 22,000 health and care workers marched through the streets of Brussels on Tuesday. They were demanding better pay and conditions across the caring professions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: They say they feel neglected and that if things don't change it will be increasingly difficult to attract new recruits to the sector. The message is that we want more nurses and that the profession of nurses has to be more attractive so there's more young people who choose for this profession because now it's really hard to have a stable family life and then have this profession.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As has happened in other European countries, the coronavirus led to burnout and illness for some health and care workers in Belgium and saw people leaving the profession altogether, creating job shortages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Belgian government has acknowledged the problems, but unions say it hasn't come up with any solutions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European automobile industry is urging EU leaders to put in place an ambitious and structured industrial policy to rival those of other world regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: policy to rival those of other world regions. According to Luca Di Maio, the new president of the European Automobile Manufacturers Association, Europe's approach is to regulate the industry to achieve zero emissions, while other regions like the United States and China are stimulating their industry in the green transition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Speaking to journalists at the association's headquarters in Brussels, Di Maio demanded decisive action to avoid the risk of de-industrialization in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I think we need a frame that puts us in a competitive, in the possibility of being competitive on a worldwide base, because this is also important.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Our industry is a global industry, so we don't do local, local products. So I think for us, Europe is the starting point of an ecosystem that is global. And we need the authorities. We need the authorities on our side to create a strategy, to create competitive advantage of the European product and technology.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The association's push came a day before the European Commission is set to roll out proposals to support investments in green sectors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The car industry fears that electric vehicles will remain inaccessible for many customers because of the expensive raw materials used in batteries that drive up production costs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: What's missing in Europe is buying incentives, according to the association.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Accessibility of mobility is really becoming a topic also for policymakers and that is because now reality starts hitting the ground right. With the Green Deal we have had a huge amount of ambitions being enshrined in regulation and that is really pushing Europe including its industries which is good but now it needs to be implemented and established and worked out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Despite the broader economic uncertainty, sales of new cars in the EU should start to recover in 2023.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The association is expecting an increase of 5% of registrations to reach almost 10 million vehicles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Christophe Pitcher, Euro News, Brussels.
